artist: Engraver: A.B. Duhamel; Artist: after Jean-Florentine Defraine; Author: Jean-Antoine Lebrun-Tossa; Publisher: François Buisson
catalogue_raissonne:
Colas 1936
Cabinet des Modes
Le Brun
creditline:
The Minnich Collection
The Ethel Morrison Van Derlip Fund, 1966
description: Fashion periodical with a trifold hand-colored engraving of seven circles—two at the top of the page, three smaller circles in the middle, and two circles at the bottom of the page—each with a building depicted and titled underneath, top to bottom and left to right as follows: St. Genevieve, Porte St. Denis, Madrid, Les Invalides, La Bastille, La Halle, and Garde Meuble; in the center a man holding a walking stick in blue breeches, a pink and white striped coat, and a black hat; on the right are two women shown from the waist up in elaborate hats
portfolio: From Magasin des Modes nouvelles, françaises et anglaises, Paris, 1786-89
title: Magasin des Modes Nouvelles, Troisième Année, Vingt-unième Cahier, 10 Juin 1788
